intro: Lesquerella lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces distinctive, yellow-orange pods that contain numerous small, kidney-shaped seeds. Lesquerella lyrata is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
